transcript.content: Coldplay - Speed of Sound
Coldplay. Speed of sound. Steve, I know you eh, like an insight to my um, musical taste and all that
Always
But, that's my favourite Coldplay track of all time, I just thought I'd eh, just throw that in
Not a fan of clocks?
Uhh, no I think I've uh, overplayed parachutes a little bit an- but that's my favourite one, like it.
I'm afraid to say I'm a bit of a philistine when it comes to Coldplay, that sounds the same as all the other ones. I'm sorry to say
Oh.. You'll have to meet these boys one day
Yeah well, well I'll tell them to their face, I don't care. Little bit rock 'n roll.
Ricky Laughs
I don't care
Well, I'm Ricky Gervais, that little uh, funny little worzel type voice over there is Stephen Merchant. And with us our, producer, Karl Pilkington. All right?
All right
Whatever we say producer, of course, that is in inverted commas.
Yeah.
Done with the fingers.

Well ye- he didn't have it, I wanted to play something off my iPod today to record it 'cause they didn't have it here, um, it's a great track called Antony and the Johnsons. He didn't even have the lead. He went alrigh-
Right

Typical. And he, and he went is it any good? I went yeah it's really good, and he went why haven't we got it here already then? Oh! Oh that's th- yeah, that's the paradigm is it? If XFM haven't got it, it's no good. 4 Non Blondes doing well is it, that still in the cupboard, is it? Unbelievable. We're a little bit annoyed today aren't we actually
I'm really annoyed
Yeah. All that stuff we did last week. Um, th- that lindauer sent us some sparkling wine, and we thought right, we're, well you, shamelessly plugged it
Yeah.
How many times did you mention it? About 20 times?
I must have  mentioned it about 20 times.
We're, we're, the finale was hitting Karl on the head with a cork. That's on my website by the way.
Okay
Rickygervais.com, go there and see Karl being hit in the head with a cork.
Yeah
Right, and we and we said let's send us free stuff and we'd talk about it.
Nothing. The, the, the, the cupboard is empty
I mean literally nothing
The cupboard is bare.
No one has thought, I tell you what, there's t-, there's, there's those guys from, the office.
Yeah.
Uh- eh- I- I mean..
I mean let's be honest, Rick. We are taste makers.
Yeah
We are opinion formers, you and I
Yeah, yeah
And you know, you'd have thought if anyone was going to send us some free stuff.
Yeah, I, I, I'll mention them all.
You know? It makes me fume
Yeah
And you know what it is? It's because people, PR people and that they've realised, no one's listening.
But not only are we going against all our principles and losing our dignity just for some free stuff
And integrity
And integrity yeeeeaah-
Steve spazzes out
We're going against XFM policy because, we are, obvi- obviously they would have got, thousands of pounds for lindauer to be mentioned last week
Oh come on, Rick
20 time- no well no..
It's XFM, Rick
40 quid for.. 40 quid for a nine minute advert.
Ex- exactly
So advertise your, to- quality stuff
Yeah
Jeff's Garage. Cheaper than some other garages. Uhh, it would- it do with, uhh, anyon- uh, uh, actually..
Didn't we play an advert once for a tattoo parlour?
Ye- Yes!
Do you remember that? I'm sure we played an advert for a tattoo parlour
Yeah
I mean co- what tattoo parlour can afford to advertise on a radio station? Unless it's a tinpot one like this
Oh God! I've got good, some good music today though, Steve
Oh really, I hope so, I'll be the judge of that, go on, but go on
We- wha- we- AC/DC?
Ohhh!
AC/DC - You Shook Me All Night Long

Have you got a bit of ah, bare skin, you need ah, colouring in? Come along to, ah.. Ron's bike shop and tattoo parlour. He'll write "mum", on your hand and give your Harley a tune up, while you wait. I can't believe no one wants to advertise with us.
And that only costs, what, 20 quid?
Yeah
And they play that-
I mean, I turned down millions of pounds to do adverts, because I think it's beneath me, I don- and I thought last week I'll give a little bit back. I'll give. I'll excite all these people
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
When it’s like that, that’s what I did, take it back.
And the underarms as well. Yeah, they really got a lot of underarm hair. Even the women one's-
Really? That’s disgusting.
I know, I don't know-I don't even know why they breed. I don't how they get laid- Some of those horrible, old, hairy, ginger, orangutans.
Yeah, they are particularly grim, some of those.
I know, yeah.
The big ones-
Ginger ones. Yeah. They can't be a happy, can they?
What is that, why’s, why is, where did that-happen? The the ginger thing? Why do people give them, like, a hard time an’ that?
Well you just gave them a hard time then, so why did you do it?—
Well people do give-I don't understand why, but Ginger people get quite a bit of stick, and I've never understood it.
No, It’s just, I don’t know why.
I mean, they do, don’t they?
I don't know, it might be historical. It might have been because, I don’t- I’m  sure it’s not everywhere in the world. I'm sure it's probably -
No, they have, They’re always, I’ve said to you about, like-
Ginger cats are always fat because they’re sort of sick of it, probably.
Play a record, Karl
Wait wait wait, what do you mean, ginger cats- what do you mean they’re sick of it?
Well, when you see a ginger cat-
They've been eating like because they're upset, they’re being bullied-whatever?
Yeah, because they’re fed up and that, you never see a thin, happy Ginger Cat running about, it's always overweight, looking a bit fed up. It's just a good point, innit?
I wouldn’t say it’s a good point, Karl, it’s a point-
So last week, the Chinese don't age well, now, anything Ginger, including cats, are sick of it.
No, but I, I'm just saying I don’t
Are you ginger? Would you like to take issue with any of Karl’s points? 83Xfm is the text, you can text us, Maybe you’ve got- maybe you've seen a thin ginger cat-
I’m not going to go though. That's what I'm saying. I'm just saying it's weird how people give ‘em a hard time, and if, if I could have hair, I'd go for ginger hair rather than being bald.
Really?
Hmmm
Ben Folds - Landed
Landed from Ben Folds on XFM 104.9 Ricky Gervais, Steven Merchant, Karl Pilkington

Had a fax, never mind champagne- and freebies like that, forget that. We're not doing that anymore. It didn't work. Okay, but, we are still in demand. Got a fax here. All right, “So guys, I produce a program for the BAS Scientists, right, wintering in Antartica”. Now, what this bloke is saying is, there are scientists-right- researching in Antarctica and they’ll soon, they’re already locked away and sort of like, out of touch cause they can't get to them.
But they’re soon going to be living in 24-hour darkness, because through the midsummer here, it's - it's darkness for 24 hours for like, three months,
Jeeze

And they’re totally cut off, and he’s trying to get some stuff together, and he wants us to record a message, and it says, every year they choose a celebrity to do something, a message of their choice, They had, Rolf Harris, David Attenborough and Jonathan Ross. “This year, Ricky is the popular choice.”
Mh-hmm...
So, I'm up there with Rolf Harris, David Attenborough and Jonathan Ross.
In-in terms of the vote amongst some scientists stuck in a hut in Antarctica for three months, so...
I think they've just-they've just got cabin fever. They've got-
So that's another po-so that's another poll I've won. British Antarctic scientists in a hut poll.
If I was trapped in a little room with several other men for three months of pitch darkness-
Ooh, sexist.
Or indeed women.
Yeah.
I can't imagine why I'd ever want a message from Rolf Harris.
(laughs)
What is wrong-I mean David Attenborough, fascinating.
Well I assume
It's the si-it's the-it's the animal. I assume they're researching penguins or something aren't they? If they're stuck out there. Or maybe-
But what's that got to do with Rolf?
-seismic activity or maybe polar uh uh shift, I don't know.
Possibly if you were researching kangaroos...
Yeah. Well he knows about all animals, doesn't he? You can take him a budgie with a broken wing and he'll sort it out. Or he knows a man who does.
Sure.
He can y'know he'll sort that out for ya. And he'll do a picture of it.
(laughs)
While you wait. So uh-But anyway, I thought 'they want a fight minute message'. We can do
Better than that. Let's dedicate the whole show to them, Steve.
We're gonna do what?
Dedicate the whole show to them. What was it, trouble with my diction?
A little bit. I'm just thinking again y'know we've gotta slow down cos these guys are there, they're working, they're busy.
They're used to uh speaking eloquent English
Yeah exactly. They're used to talking to intelligent, yeah educated people. So Karl should be something of a surprise to them. I imagine they'll just flood back early to come back to study him.
(laughs) So, this is uh this show is dedicated to all you scien- I know nothing about them. I don't know how many there are. I know
They just... as I say in a hut somewhere. Presumably with a laptop. Drinking uh hot chocolate out of steel mugs with-
Just looking up porn.
(laughs) Well they're not on the internet, are they?
Oh are they not?
Well no there's no phone line.
Well how do they charge up the laptop, when it runs out?
Well they've probably got generators.
They must have other stuff though. They've got Tele and that, haven't they?
Of course they haven't.
No for DVDs and things.
Well they could probably-yeah they could probably have a DVD player that would run off a generator and stuff. So they could play-I don't know what we're giving
This on CD or something.
Hmm.
But um..
And what are-what-

How can that enhance your life though? That you-two months has gone, you've sat there. You're chewing Kendal mint cake and uh just looking around at a white wall thinking that The Thing is going to come in any minute and put you out of your misery.
(laughs) Yeah.
And you go 'Alright lads it's here', 'what?', 'five minute message from Ricky Gervais'.
(laughs) Yeah.
"Eh, fella from The Office', 'Oh yeah. Go on'. I mean-
Yeah.
-so I don't know I can enhance-I mean I get compared to-
One of them's going 'I voted for Ricky Martin! What?'
(laughing) Yeah.
But I don't understand
Um, what they're researching. Now, you said penguins but that's just a hypothesis.
Well we're assuming that cos it's Antarctica wh-where... the uh the penguins live.
Is there anything else there? What else is going on?
There's a lot-
There's presumably climate differences-
Well yeah cos it's a-
-and atmospheric changes and so on.

-land mass isn't it? Arctic's just on ice and Ant-is actually a continent. It's a land mass. So there's stuff there. But presumably not in the winter. I imagine it's like ten foot of snow and really not a lot happening.
Sure.
I don't know what the research and they could be
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]

Energy. I think there are six scientists staying over the winter, as well as a doctor, electrician, mechanic and a carpenter and so on. And so he's saying uhh, they do listen, they can't, they have the internet so they maybe can listen to the show on the internet and if you get the chance say hi to Francis and the rest of the winter is for me. Sure, no problem, yeah, thanks James. But yeah, there they are. That's what they're doing. That's what they're up to.
But why, why are they asking you for a message though when, I mean, have these people got families and that or are they convicts or what?
I don't. No. What do you mean, of course they got.
They probably do get messages from their family.
Why are you doing one for one. Is that? I mean, say, d'you know like you see in like Porridge and stuff like that, where if someone's in prison and no one visits 'em.
Yeah.
And they sort of look a bit fed up and that. Is this message that you're doing for like people who don't get a letter in the post from?
Brilliant. So they, they put this on the shelf until someone doesn't get one. "Alright Hargreaves." "Yes sir, I didn't get a message today sir." "You have got a message, Hargreaves."

"I've what sir?" "Hargreaves you have got a message." "Really sir?" "From Ricky Gervais." "Really sir?" And then they give it. Don't talk. Don't talk. Please, there are scientists listening. Try to keep the talking shit down to a minimum today.
What's annoying me is here, right. They're saying they're stuck over there for months, but it seems to me like they're wasting a lot of time. Right.
Why?
Well, you're saying they probably watch DVDs, they're saying they've got internet access.
Yeah.
Yeah.
Was I wrong?
Listening, listening to messages. Get the job done and go home. Do it in a week.
Well that's subtle. Well then we don't have to tell 'em anything then cause they, they listen to the internet. If they've got the internet then yeah, its a waste of time. Good point, play a record.

Well hang on, before that. Here's a good point. You've had long time to research what's been going on in the world. We've just had an email here from Nicholas who says, "why haven't you told them about the recent Pig Olympics that just went on in China?" You've missed that one Karl once again.
Who won?

'First of the gang to die' - Morrissey, XFM104.9, I'm Ricky Gervais, with me Stephen Merchant and Karl Pilkington. Well Karl, you've failed miserably. There's scientists stuck away. Right, one more chance. What, what's happened in the last couple of weeks? Just one more chance to, what have you seen in the last couple of weeks?
Ahh well, like I said, I don't, I don't really watch the news an' that.
Right.
So I can't tell 'em about that. But in a way, I think they're better off not knowing, I think that's the only good thing about being out there innit. Not knowing about the bad stuff going on.
Yeah,
So, I can't help 'em there.
They don't need to look at the weather do they?
No, don't need to. But uhh, I told you that the pope an' that.
Yeah, pretty extensive.
What about the EU Constitution and the, ahh, the no votes.
What ahh, what do you make of that? What're your views?
Uhh. What, what's the problem there?
Ohh F-. This, this isn't, this isn't, this isn't broadcasting though is it. This is nothing.
No, but its better not knowing, isn't it? It's better not knowing.
Come up with something. Talk.
Well the fat baby, then. The fat baby that they found, that was on the telly. Ricky: Right. Well, what was that?
It's just a little fat baby. That ahh, ahh.
Oh for F-
I don't know mu-. Its just, just a little fat kid an' that.
What? Tell 'em what? What is?
It was on the telly, it was on the telly an' that.
But what was on the telly? You just said fat baby, fat baby, fat baby, fat baby on telly, fat baby on telly.
Telly, d- you're meant to be telling them what's happened in the world. Tell, w- tell me about the fat baby on telly!

It's just they've found some uhh. There's, there's this illness, called momo, alright? And uhh. They've just got this, this woman had a kid. It's really sad, it was on Channel 4 and that, alright? And uhh. The kid's born
Are you sure it wasn't Jimmy Carr?
Kid's born and that, alright.
Momo?
It's called momo, yeah
Isn't that, that black music award?
I dunno, alright, little, little fat baby and that and uhh. There's only, three of them in the world. These little fat babies
Right.
And uhh.
They're endangered
How fat? You're not tellin- what do you mean? How fat are they?
Six stone it was, it was only two. And uhh, there's, there's three of them in the world, and there was this one, and there was one in Brazil.
Are they like endangered? Is that the problem, because there's only three of them in the world? I'm a bit worried, is there like a conservation campaign?
Are they hunted for their flesh?
Nah it's, it's sad, I know this is isn't the show for this, but if you'd seen it you'd go oh that's a bit, bit sad and that. Umm.
Well I haven't seen it and I know nothing about it.
Well I've told you, there's three of them in the world
I just. I don't. I. Okay, what else was on telly?
Uhh, the uhh, something I watched the other night which was good. Uhh, again, you know how I learn stuff from the, from the telly, I don't watch the news
Well you don't learn stuff from the telly
I'll tell you what though
You've told us there's a fat baby in the world. There's a spider that eats chickens and there was a fat kid. That's-
Alright, forget them in Iceland, right?
Yeah.
We'll give them Rockbusters, later, to do right
Iceland!
But what's her name? I tell you what is interesting, Steve. Um. I didn't know that much about it. Au- Autism.
Okay
Oh good, some more entertaining stuff on Xfm 104.9
No, no, no
To cheer up people. Go on, what? what? Go on
No, right, have you heard about it Steve?
Autism?

It scares me to death when he comes up, when he touches on a serious subject. It- ah- we've been talking about wheeling a dead Pope round. The Chinese don't age well and ginger people are hated, and now we're going to touch on a really, I mean, ah- ah- my heart's in my throat go on Karl then. Tell me, tell me your insights to autism.
Right, well what it is, this, again, Channel 4, coming up with some good stuff at the moment. Right. It might have been Channel 5
Ricky laughs
But what's her name? It was-
It's the attention span that I like
It's these, these people who uhh, they've got like this autism thing going on.
Yep

And uhh, they sort of take in a lot of information, they get sort of a bit, they get so into it that they know everything about that subject and what have you, right? And there was this lad, who uhh. He knew everything, right, about EastEnders
Right?

He sort of, the cameraman was saying to him, uhh, so, you know, why, why EastEnders and that? He said, oh I don't know, I just like it. And he said that, I remember when I first watched it, it was a Thursday, it was five to eight, Pauline Fowler walked in, she had a pink jumper on, she said "alright love"? And he remembers everything from that moment on.
Yeah
Right, and everything, which is great, but then, the way the program was making out, it was almost like they were saying it's, it's a disability
Right
When in a way, it's more like a superpower
Sure. Like, like "Rain-Man".
If-If you can take- no, I’m not-
It’s Rain Man, he has special autistic powers. We must send for Rain Man
Oh god, I don't know what to do.
So what you’re saying is he’d be a great contestant on mastermind? -he’d be dynamite-
There’s other things- sorry-
What I’m saying is, don't be watching EastEnders. Sort of why didn't they give him an encyclopedia, and say get into that-
Sure
That will be useful. Yeah keep ‘em away from Eastenders, wasting his time there, but I don't think it's a- it is a disability.
No.
Yeah- there are other things and that they're not all like-

Also, autism is a matter of degrees, from what I know, and I'm sorry to have to do this, but I feel that I have to at least be the voice of reason, as ill educated as I am on the subject, but I think; one, there's degrees of autism, I think some are higher performance than others. There's other - there's other issues with it. It's not they just, they just got good memories. They don't go around doing tricks for people, because they can remember stuff. There are other - there are other issues with it.
Like What?
Do you know what I mean?
Well, They seemed a bit-
Well, you watched the program. What did you learn? That he knows when Pauline Fowler came in?
Yeah, I mean there was other bits where they couldn’t control their emotions and stuff.
Oh, the other - that other little bit yeah-

The main -the main bit of it was he can soak up information and stuff, and I'm just saying he didn't seem really bad, you know what I mean, there’s disabilities where people say “that's a bad disability”, you know how people say about, eh..
This is brilliant this, it’s just like, this is amazing to be in the room with this man. It's incredible. You just wind him up and listen to what comes out, and I'm gonna sit back now-
And I'm not going to defend you or explain anything, just tell me, go on then and tell me about the other disabilities that are worse-
No, What I mean is, how people can sometimes easily get mixed up. Um, How people are scared of like a cyclop. But at the end of the day, he’s got a disability. A bloke with-
Who’s scared of a cyclop apart from Jason and his Argonauts, where have you- where’s this cyclop that you're scared of?
No, I'm just saying in history and in books and that-
No, No, No, not in history - history happened.
Yeah, but -

What are you thinking of, your mixing history with Greek mythology and Roman mythology and every other type of Mythology. What do you mean there wasn't really a giant Cyclops that went around picking up ships and throwing them around. That's not history, Karl. Do you think Batman's history?
No, but this was, it was ages ago, wasn’t it, when we were sort of forming-
No I’m not saying it didn't happen ages ago, I'm saying it didn't happen.
Well, it might have done, I mean what's so ridiculous about a fella with one eye?
In the middle of his head and he's big and scary and lives in a cave?
Why is he scary? Cause he’s got - If he had eight eyes I’d be scared of him. At the end of the day he’s got a dis- oh, we’ll talk about it in a bit...
“Across 110th Street”, Bobby Womack
Across 110th Street on Xfm, 104.9. I’m Ricky Gervais, with me Stephen Merchant and over there Karl Pilkington.
Can I just remind people that -
A man so stupid, it isn't actually offensive, I just want to put that out there.
Yeah, Yeah, Yeah
Okay, good.

I just want to remind people that they can get in touch on the text 83 Xfm. You'll need that text number shortly because we’re gonna be paying RockBusters very soon and Gave has texted in, and he says, quite simply, “What happened to the webcam? All I can see is a bald monkey.
Well, You’re absolutely right, We’ll try to get that sorted out for ya. But we're RockBustering now?.
Wanna do it now? Set it up now?
Okay, great. So you should just remind people Rick, particularly if they're trapped in Antarctica for the next few months, what this game is?

Well, this is um, Blockbusters, just totally ripped off, and the clues are bands and artists. They-Karl says they’re cryptic clues. They're not cryptic clues, they’re are more like - what word am I thinking of, they’re tenuous, some of them don’t work at all.

Um, So it's it's really are you in tune with a shaved monkey? I mean, it's nearly embarrassing to get the clue. I pride myself on that I don't really get them and I'll um, I'm sort of proud of that because you shouldn't. Yeah. But anyway, I think I've given it a big sell, now you do win tat today, but the big prize is going forward to be in the draw in five weeks time, when there's a sign to Homer that I got Matt Groening to draw.
If you go to rickygervais.com, you can see him drawing it. It's an original.
Well if they want to see it they can go to Xfm.co.uk/ricky and it's actually - just click on it. You can have a look at it.

You can see all the pictures there, can’t you? There’s also a signed Nigel Tufnel poster, and us three as Flanimals. But as a little extra video clip, that was on rickygervais.com you can actually see Matt Groening drawing it.
So those prizes are the ones that- the big prize you can win in five weeks time- When-if you get to the Grand Final.
In the meantime, it's the usual selection of mediocre gifts which will be given away-
That we found in a drawer that people have sent us to give away?.
Yes, so first up we've got the I think, well I think most people would agree-the mediocre John Travolta film, “Ladder 49”, which I think barely made it into cinemas over here.
Ohh, and we're giving that away?
We’re giving it away! On DVD, the TV series “Grumpy Old Men”, which I think is repeated every single night on BBC Two.
Oh, and that's free as well as it?
Yeah, that's free. Okay, we've got the complete third series of Alias-great gift, only if you've seen the previous two seasons, so,
Is that the one I’m in?

I don’t know, possibly. Uh, “French and Saunders: At the movies” a collection of all their hilarious movies spoofs, again on television, I think, every Friday and the TV series “Operation: Good Guys”, you know, fine series, but you could see that on UK gold most nights. So once again an excellent selection-
But if you win all those and take them straight down Record and Tape Exchange, you will be able to get two albums that you actually like.
That's exactly right.
So -
People send us them so they sort of get bigged up on the radio. So that's done. We don't need to worry about that.
Angry
So anyway then, three Clues-
Well, hang on, let's play the jingle.
No, I haven’t got one for-
Oh, You’ve not got a jingle for RockBusters?
No
Well do one quickly, now.
Ok.. Ugh .. Rockbusters
Brilliant.

All right, so we got about three of them, cryptic clue and the initials - the band - it could be a band or an artist - we’ve done all that haven’t we. Alright, first one, “the fella let his wife know how he got the bruise on his leg.”
Give us that again
The fella let his wife know how he got the bruise on the leg. He’s got a little bruise. Hey,what’s going on?
Imagine that in the Times Crossword. You read it again - it’s slightly different. Every time I look back at this crossword, it slightly different, all the words change. It can't be cryptic.
The initials there CL, right, CL. Fellow got a bruise on his leg. He let his wife know how he got it, what's going on .. All right second one..
All the muttering, Hahaha
What's the next craptic clue?
Second one, ”That that Potter lad...
He had a lot of bottle doing all that stuff with the Wizards and that, right? He had a lot of bottle, playing with the Wizards and that, what’s- what's all that about?
I love it, he always has, “what’s all that about”

TB, the band or artist, the initials; TB. That Potter lad, he's got a lotta bottle doing all that stuff with the Wizards, and the uh, the third one; The Buddhists won't be able to get in their temple without these. Ah, What do they need? Right. The Buddhists won't be able to get in their temple without these. The Initials, TM.

83936 is the text number, and we don't want to receive emails from this because we can't be bothered. So just a quick text, make sure you include all three answers, we’re not interested unless... you need to get all three.
But the winner may only get two but - it’s first one with the most right answers that wins all those, all those DVDs - and this is a box set to be fair. That's pretty as pretty good prize, that one
Oh, you could probably get, probably get 2 CDs when you take that to Record/Tape Exchange. Just for that alone.
And you don't need to see the first 2 seasons because you won't know what's happening anyway.

Oh Ok, fine. I'm excited to think that there's some - some people now in Antarctica, just scrambling around to get a pen. Just trying to figure them out, you know, that that keep- that they'll probably stew on that for the next two months.

Feel Good Inc., Gorillas, Gorillaz, on XFM 104.9. I'm Ricky Gervais, with the, uh, Steve Merchant and Karl Pilkington - Karl, Okay, we've got to sort this out. We didn't meet again this week. And this is a shoddy show. I thought we had a sort of framework for it but-
Ha

Do you know what I mean, I thought, I, you know Carl could sorta tell them what was going on. He doesn't know anything, except watching telly - late-night telly on strange channels. Like, he gets all his information about the news on Ana-nova, and I mean - I even tried out, because monkey news last week was awful.
It wasn’t Monkey News
It wasn't Monkey News. It was awful.
I can’t remember it.
Well, why would I have, I’ve been on holiday..

Brilliant. Yeah, and Monkey News stops. I phoned him up, there was a front cover um, of the - I think it was the Telegraph - one day this week.
